Story/Walkthrough: Thomas Downes previously borrowed money from Leopold Strauss, who sends Arthur to collect the money. Arthur arrives at the Downes Ranch to reclaim the debt. He encounters Downes in the garden, and confronts him. Downes tries to hit him with a rake, but Arthur blocks it and intimidates Downes, who says he doesn't have the money. Arthur beats him and in the process, he coughs blood in Arthur's face. Arthur shrugs this off and continues demanding the money until Downes' wife notices what's happening and tells Arthur to leave, warning him that Thomas isn't well. Arthur rides back to camp and berates Strauss for lending them the money.

Overview: Arthur takes Lenny for a quiet drink in Valentine to help calm him down after learning of Micah's arrest in Strawberry.
Story/Walkthrough:
Lenny arrives back at camp with the news that Micah was arrested in Strawberry for murder and that Sheriff Hanley is going to hang him. Dutch instructs Arthur to rescue Micah later and take Lenny into Valentine to calm him down. After arriving, the duo start drinking, until a patron named Jeb annoys the pair, and Arthur can either charm, intimidate, or assault him into leaving them alone. If the player does nothing, the charm button will automatically fill slowly until full.
After drinking some more, Arthur loses Lenny and begins looking for him, drunkenly stumbling around the saloon, and finds him upstairs, trying to balance a shot glass on his forehead (before dropping it over the railing, smashing it on the floor below). Reunited, the two start drinking again, but Arthur soon loses him again and after searching the bar a second time finds Lenny downstairs trying to fight off two men from atop the bar counter. Arthur confronts the men, but ends up drunkenly line dancing with the patrons of the bar. After relieving himself outside, Arthur returns to the bar to find Lenny for the third time, but he is so drunk and inebriated by this point that he sees every patron as Lenny (with jumbled-up button prompts and misspelled text to boot). After stumbling around, drunkenly yelling after Lenny and talking to three or more patrons, Lenny finds Arthur, and the pair engage in a slap fight before they return to drinking again. Jeb then re-enters the bar, and steals Arthur's drink out of his hand. This prompts Arthur to grab Jeb by the collar.
The game then cuts to Arthur and Lenny outside, holding Jeb over a water trough. At this point the player can do one of three things before a group of lawmen confront them to arrest the duo for their drunken shenanigans, leading to Lenny's arrest and Arthur fleeing, either escaping and fleeing the town or colliding with a barrel or tripping over a fence, falling over and being arrested as well. The option chosen will affect how the mission ends, with six different endings depending on what happens during these two moments.
Do nothing: if the player does not follow the button prompts to begin trying to drown Jeb in the water trough, he will break free and run away to retrieve the law.
Attempt to drown Jeb: if the player begins the button prompts to drown the patron, but doesn't complete it in time, Jeb breaks free and runs away, retrieving the law.
Drown Jeb: if the player completes the button prompt to drown Jeb, Arthur will drown Jeb until he is unconscious and then dump him onto the ground next to the trough, the law will then find Jeb there and begin searching for the pair.
Arthur escaped from the law, didn't force Jeb into the water trough: Arthur wakes up just south of the camp but is very hung over, gagging and vomiting onto the grass. He then returns to camp to find Lenny, who states he doesn't know what happened during their escape.
Arthur was arrested with Lenny, didn't force Jeb into water trough: Arthur and Lenny wake up in Valentine jail, charged with assault. After the pair post bail, they will pause outside the office, as Lenny vomits into the street, then go their separate ways back to camp.
Arthur escapes, attempted to drown Jeb: Arthur meets with Lenny back at camp, who was arrested and had to post bail for assault. Lenny then laments last night's events with Arthur, comparing it to Micah's actions in Strawberry.
Arthur was arrested with Lenny, attempted to drown Jeb: Arthur and Lenny wake up in Valentine jail, where they have been charged with assault. After the pair post bail, they will pause outside the office, as Lenny vomits into the street, then go their separate ways back to camp.
Arthur escapes, drowned Jeb: Arthur meets with Lenny back in camp, who was arrested for attempted murder and had to post bail. Lenny then laments last night's events with Arthur, comparing it to Micah's actions in Strawberry.
Arthur was arrested with Lenny, drowned Jeb: Arthur and Lenny wake up in Valentine jail, where they have been charged with attempted murder. After the pair post bail, they will pause outside the office, as Lenny vomits into the street, then go their separate ways back to camp.

Overview: Arthur does a favor for Abigail and takes Jack out on a fishing trip.
Story/Walkthrough:
Arthur speaks to Abigail in camp, who asks him to do something fun with Jack, as he seems rather bored. Arthur is reluctant at first, but soon agrees. He heads over to Jack and greets him as he is playing in the grass. He invites Jack to come fishing with him. Jack seems interested, so Arthur mounts his horse and lifts Jack up so they can go. On the way, Jack asks Arthur if they are going back to the gang's previous campsite near Blackwater, as he left his Penny Dreadful storybook there. Arthur tells they can't go back, but promises to find Jack a new storybook.
Once at the river, the two start fishing, during which Jack decides to pick some flowers and make something. Once Arthur catches at least three fish, Jack shows him a necklace he made out of the flowers, and two Pinkertons interrupt. They introduce themselves as Agents Milton and Ross. They explain that they were dispatched to find the gang after the robbery of one of Leviticus Cornwall's trains near Granite Pass, and that they want Dutch. Arthur tries to play innocent, but Milton says that he has already seen the "philosophy lesson" from Mac Callander, whom he had captured and tortured to death after the skirmish in Blackwater. Arthur is infuriated and exchanges hostile words with Milton before the two agents leave.
On the way back to camp, Jack asks why Arthur lied about Dutch and what the agents said about Mac. Arthur hopes that Mac is "fine where he is" and tells Jack to not worry about the "disagreeable men". After returning Jack to Abigail, Arthur heads over to Dutch to tell him about Milton and Ross and asks what they should do. Dutch believes that the Pinkertons want to scare them, and decides that they should all do nothing and just stay calm.

Overview: With Micah due to be hanged for a double murder near Strawberry, Arthur attempts to break him out of jail.
Story/Walkthrough:
Arthur arrives in Strawberry, with Micah in prison. He speaks to Sheriff Hanley, pretending to be a bounty hunter who is looking for the O'Driscolls, but Hanley refuses to release Micah. After exiting, Arthur hears Micah yelling. He goes to the window of his cell, and Micah asks if Arthur is going to free him. Arthur is reluctant, given how much of a thorn in his side Micah has been for the last few months, but eventually, Arthur decides to release him.
Arthur uses a nearby steam donkey to rip out the bars of Micah's cell, allowing him to escape. Immediately after escaping, Arthur gives Micah a revolver, and Micah shoots his O'Driscoll cellmate in the head and a shootout erupts, during which Hanley is killed. With a massive group of lawmen in the town, Arthur prompts Micah to escape, but Micah refuses, saying that he has something to do. He makes his way to a house, to find an ex-associate of his named Norman, who took his prized revolvers. As Norman opens the door, he is immediately shot by Micah and then thrown on the ground, before Micah rushes into the house and kills his wife, Maddy, too. With his revolvers back in his possession, Micah then agrees to escape, and both he and Arthur eventually fend off their attackers and narrowly escape the town.[1]
After they are clear, Micah gives Arthur a second holster as thanks, but Arthur berates Micah for his recklessness in going back for his guns and for killing nearly a whole town. Micah apologises somewhat, and says that he and Arthur are "sons of Dutch", which makes them almost brothers, who sometimes make mistakes. He then says that he doesn’t want to return to Dutch empty-handed and wishes to do something to redeem himself, asking Arthur to meet him nearby in Big Valley in the near future.

Overview: Following a tip-off, Arthur and Micah rob a banking stagecoach.
Story/Walkthrough:
Arthur meets Micah at his camp near Strawberry, where Micah asks for his assistance in robbing a banking coach heading towards Strawberry, as a way to repay Arthur for his help in escaping jail.
Arthur follows Micah on horseback until they make it to their destination - a ridge, overlooking where the coach should come through. On the way, the two share a mostly belligerent conversation in which they discuss the security of the coach, and the O'Driscolls. They also argue about Micah's reckless habit of causing endless trouble.
After they reach the destination, the pair ambush the coach and take out all of the guards and the driver, before hijacking it and driving it away. Micah takes the reins, and gives Arthur a Lancaster Repeater to use, saying "that's more your style than mine". Things seem to be going well, but once the duo get close to the Dakota River, a horde of O'Driscolls attack them and try to commandeer it for themselves, cutting down a tree to block the road. In the chaos, the carriage is blown up by a stick of dynamite, and the two are thrown into the river. Arthur and Micah manage to successfully eliminate their rival outlaws in the ensuing gunfight, with the few remaining O'Driscolls fleeing.
After the robbers are taken out, Arthur meets with Micah at the overturned bank coach. At Micah's request, Arthur shoots the lock and opens the lockbox, which contains a hefty take. The two split the loot between them and then ride their separate ways back to camp.

Overview: To get her out of camp for a while, Arthur takes Sadie into Rhodes to collect supplies.
Story/Walkthrough:
Arthur comes across Pearson and Sadie having a heated argument. Sadie is discontent with having to stay in camp all day and do nothing but cook, stating that when her husband was alive, they shared the chores around their ranch. Arthur decides to take her into Rhodes to buy more supplies for Pearson. Before they leave, Pearson gives Arthur a letter to post for him.
On their way, Sadie cheekily reads Pearson's letter (which is for his aunt Cathy) while mockingly imitating him, which amuses Arthur. Upon arriving, Sadie wants to rob the store, but Arthur tells her they are not meant to cause any trouble. Sadie enters the store while Arthur goes to the post office to mail Pearson's letter. When returning to the wagon, Sadie is seen with new attire and bickering at the store clerk, who is loading boxes into the back of the wagon.
As they are heading back to the camp, Sadie expresses her sadness of how both her home and possessions were destroyed and how she used to enjoy playing the harmonica. Arthur apologizes and offers to find a new harmonica for her. Sadie just tells him to treat her like everyone else and firmly declares that no one will ever ruin her life again. Suddenly, two members of the Lemoyne Raiders approach them and order them to stop. Sadie refuses, shoots one of them and runs down another with the wagon, resulting in more members attacking.
After Arthur and Sadie fight them off, they drive the wagon back into camp, and Arthur decides to not tell Dutch about their encounter. Upon arriving, they help Pearson unload the supplies from the wagon. Sadie thanks Arthur for taking her out and Arthur replies that he would be happy to ride with her again.

Overview: Trelawny invites Arthur to see a discouraged worker at Rhodes post office about any available stagecoaches to rob.
Story/Walkthrough:
Arthur speaks to Trelawny at camp, who asks him to come to Rhodes to speak to a teller at the post office, who will be able to provide Arthur with tips about stagecoaches worth stealing.
Once Arthur and Trelawny reach town, they enter the post office, where Trelawny will start a conversation with the teller, Alden Carruthers. After a bit of small talk, Arthur gives him some money in exchange for information on a stagecoach which is due to come through Siltwater Strand. Before the pair leave, Alden tells them that there is another clerk in Strawberry who is a member of the “discouraged men” association (as Trelawny calls it).
On their way to Siltwater Strand, Arthur makes known his apprehension on returning to Strawberry, considering the damage he caused there when he rescued Micah. Trelawny assures him that there should not be anyone left who would remember him, considering that nearly the whole town was massacred. He also comments on how popular the gang is becoming with all the trouble they have been causing, and believes they will all be dead soon enough. Arthur replies that he hopes they will all be free before that happens.
Once they reach the interception point, Trelawny decides to not rob the coach violently and tells Arthur to keep his guns holstered. He hands Arthur a lock breaker to open the strongbox in the back of the coach silently while he distracts an opera singer, Chester Damsen, and her driver. They see the coach, and Trelawny rides up to it and convinces Damsen to sing to him while Arthur rides further behind to avoid being seen. While Damsen sings to Trelawny, Arthur silently opens the lockbox, seizes the money, and sneaks away.
Trelawny joins him soon afterwards after the coach leaves, and the two share the take between them.

Overview: Arthur, Micah, Bill and Sean go to meet some of the Gray boys in Rhodes to discuss a security job.
Story/Walkthrough:
Arthur meets the other three gang members in Rhodes for the “job”, although both he and Sean are deeply suspicious. Before they can voice any more concerns, they are suddenly ambushed by the Grays. Sean is instantly killed by a shot to the head, and Bill is shot in the shoulder. A massive shootout erupts between the remaining three outlaws and the Gray gunmen.
During the gunfight, Bill is captured by Sheriff Leigh Gray, leaving only Arthur and Micah to fight off the Grays. Both of them break into the Gunsmith's and use it as cover. After the two come out victorious, they approach the Sheriff's office and demand the release of Bill. Along with Archibald MacGregor and two other lawmen, the Sheriff comes out with a gun to Bill's head but is promptly shot in the head and killed by Arthur. In the next few seconds, Archibald and his two allies are subsequently gunned down by Arthur, or by Micah if the player is not quick enough.
With the gunfight over, Arthur reprimands Bill and Micah for their carelessness and expresses his affection for Sean, before asking Bill to give Sean a proper burial.

Overview: Suspecting it was Catherine Braithwaite who kidnapped Jack, the van der Linde gang ride to Braithwaite Manor to get him back.
Story/Walkthrough:
Upon returning to camp after the events in Rhodes, Arthur learns from Abigail that Jack has disappeared. The gang quickly determines that the Braithwaites took him as revenge for the gang stealing their prized horses. Enraged, Dutch, Arthur, Hosea, John, Charles, Bill, Javier, and Lenny ride to Braithwaite Manor to find Jack.
Upon the gang's arrival, Dutch confronts one of the Braithwaites, and a gunfight erupts. After the gang dispatches the majority of the Braithwaite resistance, Dutch and Hosea venture inside the manor and find Catherine Braithwaite and her sons hiding in a room, barricaded inside. Outside, the gang fends off an attack, and Arthur finds a way into the barricaded room. After killing two of Catherine's sons, the gang locates Catherine and threatens her, demanding Jack's location. When a search of the manor comes up empty, the gang decides to burn the house down. Seeing that one of her sons is barely alive, Dutch shoots him to increase Catherine's agony before dragging her out of her house as the rest of the gang burn it to the ground.
Once outside, Catherine reveals that her sons gave Jack to Angelo Bronte, and the gang decides not to kill her. As the gang rides back to camp, Catherine runs back into her burning home, where she ultimately dies.

Overview: John and Arthur clear out the last remaining Lemoyne Raiders from Shady Belle before the gang relocate their caravan there.
Story/Walkthrough:
The morning after the assault on the Braithwaite Manor, Dutch and Hosea unsuccessfully attempt to reassure John that Jack will be safe and rescued soon. Pinkerton agents Milton and Ross find the gang's camp at Clemens Point. They offer the gang a deal: that they will be spared and granted amnesty if they leave and allow Dutch to be captured. Every gang member refuses and subsequently warn Milton to leave the camp. Flustered, Milton says that he’ll return with fifty men and that the gang should evacuate the area.
Resultantly, the gang are forced to move again. Recalling Shady Belle, a manor house discovered earlier by Lenny, with a remote location due to it being situated deep within the forest, Dutch sends Arthur and John to investigate it and clear out any remaining Lemoyne Raiders. On the way, John speaks of his dismay over Dutch and Hosea's failed scam with the two families and expresses regret for not taking good enough care of Jack. When they get there, they notice that there are a few Lemoyne Raiders, so the pair kill them and dump their bodies in the swamp just outside. John goes back to the rest of the gang to show them the way, and the gang arrive shortly afterwards. While the others set up the camp, Arthur and Dutch will ride off to the nearby city, Saint Denis, to begin searching for Jack.

Overview: Arthur, Dutch and Hosea go out on a fishing trip.
Story/Walkthrough:
The three men ride out of camp with the intent on going on a fishing trip. Not long after leaving camp, the men encounter Archibald MacGregor and Leigh Gray - the town's deputy and sheriff respectively - transporting a wagon of captured criminals. Dutch spots Trelawny in the back small cell in the back of the wagon, and asks why he is there. Sheriff Gray tells Dutch that Trelawny was caught running an illegal gold prospecting operation, while Anders Anderson springs the lock and escapes with his henchmen.
The Anderson boys jump onto the back of a train speeding away, after which Dutch offers that Arthur will bring them back in exchange for Trelawny's release. The Sheriff agrees, so Archibald jumps aboard Arthur's horse and they give chase to the train. Realizing they cannot keep up with the speeding train, Archibald tells Arthur to jump aboard it, which he does. Arthur moves across the train, knocking out the Anderson boys until he at last comes to Anders, who is beaten unconscious after he attacks Morgan with a knife. After the train stops, Arthur and Archibald put Anders on the back of Arthur's horse and ride to Rhodes. The Sheriff keeps his promise and releases Trelawny, before asking the trio to come back and visit him sometime. Arthur then has the option of going fishing with Dutch and Hosea, or returning to camp.

Overview: Dutch asks you to sniff around Caliga Hall to see what you can find out about the Grays.
Story/Walkthrough:
Arthur will first ride to Caliga Hall, where he will go to the front entrance of the property. The guards stop him, but after telling them that Leigh Gray permitted him to look around, they let him through. He then heads to the front steps, and finds a servant who he will question about the family. The servant will tell him to speak to Beau Gray, who is round the side of the house.
Beau will greet Arthur, and then go on to talk about his Romeo and Juliet-style love for Penelope Braithwaite, a woman from a rival plantation family. Arthur is rather bemused and goes to leave, but cannot resist the temptation of being offered money to give Penelope a love letter and gift from Beau.

Overview: Arthur, Dutch and Bill become temporarily deputized citizens of the Scarlett Meadows Sheriff's Office as they help Archibald shut down a moonshine distillery and steal a wagon-load of the Braithwaites' moonshine.
Story/Walkthrough:
Arthur meets Dutch and Bill at the Scarlett Meadows Sheriff Office in Rhodes, where Dutch will tell him that Sheriff Gray has made them temporary deputies, so that they can help Archibald shut down a moonshine distillery. Arthur and Archibald mount a wagon, while Dutch and Bill ride behind them. Archibald regales Arthur with the Rhodes history, as well as the Gray-Braithwaite feud. Along the way, they will come across the dead body of a Lemoyne state legislator named Fredrick Mitchell, who was killed by the Lemoyne Raiders.
The four men finally arrive at the swamp where the moonshiners are working, and they split up. Arthur and Bill take one side and knock out the moonshiners over there, while Dutch and Archibald attack the other side. They then pick up the moonshiners, as well as the moonshine itself, and deposit them in the wagon.
Archibald then tells Arthur and Bill to blow up the moonshiners' distillery with dynamite. Arthur does so, but the buyers, who are a group of Lemoyne Raiders, hear the commotion from their camp nearby. A gunfight ensues, and Arthur and Bill fight them off. The pair then return to the carriage, where they see that Archibald has not yet destroyed the moonshine. He explains that it is "traditional" for the law to drink the moonshine as reward for dealing with the criminals, and offers most of it to the gang. Dutch accepts, and Bill drives the wagon back to camp while Archibald escorts the captured moonshiners away.
As Arthur and Dutch ride off together, Dutch says that with the help of Hosea, he reckons that they will be able to play both the Grays and the Braithwaites from both sides. Arthur teases Dutch on how he is talking like "the young Dutch", and Dutch challenges him to a race back to camp, which the player can choose to accept or decline.

Overview: Uncle receives a tip-off and rides off with Arthur, Charles and Bill to rob a wagon carrying payroll.
Story/Walkthrough:
In camp, Molly O'Shea calls Arthur over to talk to him about Dutch. However, they are quickly interrupted by Uncle, who has received a tip-off about a supply wagon which is allegedly unguarded. Arthur is at first reluctant, but agrees on it as long as Uncle comes along.
Arthur, Uncle, Charles, and Bill ride out to the crossroads and see the wagon. However, after they stop it, the wagon driver reveals that he works for Cornwall Kerosene & Tar, so when Charles and Arthur loot the wagon, a large number of Cornwall's guards in the vicinity descend upon the gang. Realising that they cannot win by fighting, the gang members flee on horseback into the woods, before hiding in an abandoned barn in an attempt to lose their pursuers.
At night, some of Cornwall's guards arrive on the property to search for the four gang members. An inhabitant of the house informs the guards that they heard something coming from the barn a few hours ago, and so the guards head towards it. The gang try to stay hidden as the guards enter, but Bill accidentally knocks over a bucket, and the gang is forced to fight, with huge numbers of guards attacking them from every direction. The barn eventually begins to burn down during the skirmish due to a smashed lantern, resulting in the four retreating into the woods.
Once in the trees, they split up; Arthur goes with Uncle and Charles goes with Bill, and after eventually reuniting and finishing off the last of their pursuers, the four split the take and separately make their way back to camp.

Overview: Dutch asks you to sniff around Caliga Hall to see what you can find out about the Grays.
Story/Walkthrough:
Arthur will first ride to Caliga Hall, where he will go to the front entrance of the property. The guards stop him, but after telling them that Leigh Gray permitted him to look around, they let him through. He then heads to the front steps, and finds a servant who he will question about the family. The servant will tell him to speak to Beau Gray, who is round the side of the house.
Beau will greet Arthur, and then go on to talk about his Romeo and Juliet-style love for Penelope Braithwaite, a woman from a rival plantation family. Arthur is rather bemused and goes to leave, but cannot resist the temptation of being offered money to give Penelope a love letter and gift from Beau.

Overview: Beau Gray asks Arthur to deliver a letter to Penelope Braithwaite at Braithwaite Manor.
Story/Walkthrough: Arthur will first ride to Braithwaite Manor, where he will attempt to sneak undetected to the back of the manor, where Penelope is. After reaching Penelope, Arthur will deliver her Beau's letter, and she will give you one of her own. You will once again sneak out of the manor, and deliver it to Beau.

Overview: At the request of Beau, Arthur drives Penelope and other protesters through Rhodes as they participate in a women's suffrage rally lead by Olive Calhoon.
Story/Walkthrough: After delivering Penelope's letter to Beau, he will grow alarmed, due to reading that she is planning on joining a march for the women's suffrage movement. Beau tells Arthur that her life is in danger, and he will gladly pay money in exchange for his help in stopping her. After arriving at the stagecoach that the protesters are riding in, they confront Penelope. She refuses to leave, although she allows Arthur to drive the carriage, so that he can protect her. Arthur will drive the carriage through Rhodes, before dismounting, which then, as the protesters are protesting, Beau’s cousins, Iain and Scott, who notice Beau and attempts to take him. Arthur then excuses them and they leave, with Iain and Scott briefly following them into the alley beside the Bank of Rhodes. The player can choose whether to defuse the cousins, in which, they will let Arthur and Beau go, or knock them out. Either way, Arthur and Beau then ride their horses to Bolger Glade. Afterwards, Beau pays Arthur for his troubles.

Overview: Catherine Braithwaite pays Hosea and Arthur to head into Rhodes and hand out the stolen moonshine for free at the local saloon.
Story/Walkthrough:
Part I[]
Whilst at camp, Abigail informs Arthur that Hosea and John are waiting at the stolen moonshine stash for him, to attempt to sell it back to the Braithwaites, and that Hosea wants Arthur to join him instead, because John has now been instructed by Dutch to look into something else. Arthur heads over to them.
Part II[]
Arthur meets the pair, and they explain what they plan to do with the moonshine. Hosea explains that since he doesn't have a client to sell the moonshine to, he says that he plans to instead take the stash to the Braithwaites, under the pretense that he was returning lost goods, for a reward. John leaves so he can look into potentially stealing the Braithwaites' prized race horses, for Dutch.
Upon reaching Braithwaite Manor, Hosea explains his intentions to Catherine Braithwaite, the family matriarch, and requests a reward of half of what the stolen moonshine bottles usually cost. Her sons are initially hostile towards Hosea and Arthur, but Catherine orders them to stand down and pay the two. However, Catherine reveals she already knows that Sheriff Leigh Gray was the one who had them take the moonshine, and tells them to hand out the moonshine for free in the local saloon owned by the Grays, for an extra $10. Hosea and Arthur comply and head for Rhodes.
On the way, Hosea decides that he and Arthur assume the roles of two brothers named Melvin and Fenton, as part of their classic clown-and-idiot act, in order to give the moonshine away at the saloon, much to the latter's chagrin. Upon arriving at the saloon, Arthur and Hosea introduce themselves and announce that they will be serving all-you-can-drink moonshine to patrons, for no cost at all, much to their joy.
Hosea and Arthur serve out the moonshine into all into the night, with the drunken chaos and disorder growing by the hour. However, later on, the Lemoyne Raiders enter the saloon and they confront the duo, who are very angry to see what has been happening with the moonshine they were going to buy. A shootout ensues in the saloon, and Hosea and Arthur fight their way out before using the wagon to escape Rhodes while killing more pursuing Raiders. Once the coast is clear, they discuss the nature of the Raiders, and whether the Braithwaites set them up. Hosea heads back to Braithwaite manor, while Arthur returns to camp to speak with Dutch.
Once there, Arthur talks with Dutch and Micah about the two feuding families, and their plan to use the feud as a means to supposedly rob them of large amounts of money and gold. Arthur is initially unsure of whether the plan is a good idea, given the massive amount of trouble they are already in with the law. He also doesn't believe in vengeance, which is one of Dutch's motives behind this plan, as Dutch has a deep hatred for southerners which stems from the death of his father during the Civil War.
Nonetheless, Arthur goes along with Dutch's plan: Dutch tries to play the Grays, whilst Hosea tries to play the Braithwaites. As for Arthur's next move, he can either choose to meet up with Hosea and Sean at Braithwaite Manor, to look into the Grays' tobacco fields, or meet up with John and Javier at Caliga Hall, to look into the Braithwaites' prized race horses.

Overview: Arthur and Charles go to track down Trelawny at his rental caravan in Rhodes.
Story/Walkthrough:
Remembering Trelawny's warnings about bounty hunters in the area, Arthur goes to speak with Dutch, who brushes it off as most likely a rumor, but nonetheless asks him and Charles to go check on Trelawny, as they haven't heard from him for some time. The pair investigate his caravan in Rhodes and find signs of violence, before deducing that he must have been taken by bounty hunters.
Arthur and Charles follow Trelawny's trail to the woods, where they find two men - with Trelawny's walking cane next to them. They each subdue a man and interrogate one of them, who informs them that Trelawny is being held at a nearby farm near Braithwaite Manor.
The pair ride there and find Trelawny and the bounty hunters (working under Cole Stoudemire) who kidnapped him near the Braithwaite family's corn fields, but the hunters scatter into the fields upon being discovered, forcing Arthur and Charles to search for them in a game of cat and mouse.
After dealing with all three bounty hunters - one of whom takes Arthur hostage and is killed by Charles - the duo take care of two more hiding in the barn before return to Trelawny, who claims that he told his kidnappers nothing. He then decides to stay with the gang at their camp, until it's safe to live on his own again. The mission ends with Charles and Trelawny leaving Arthur and riding back to camp.

Overview: Working with the Braithwaites, Arthur and Sean drive to Caliga Hall with the remaining moonshine and attempt to use it to burn the Grays' tobacco fields.
Story/Walkthrough:
Arthur arrives at Braithwaite Manor and tells the guards he has business with Catherine Braithwaite, so the guards let him in. Arthur enters the manor and the butler takes him into the living room where Catherine, Hosea and Sean are playing Cribbage. Bartholomew, one of the sons is also there. Catherine asks if Arthur is as "dumb as he looks", but Hosea assures her he will get the job done if the payment is right. Bartholomew responds to this with an insult before Sean and Arthur leave and head outside to a wagon loaded with moonshine, with Arthur bluntly denying Sean's request to drive.
As they set off, Arthur comments on how silent Sean was earlier. Sean says that it wasn't easy and expresses his dislike for Bartholomew and Catherine, which makes Arthur laugh. He then explains that they are going to burn down the Grays' tobacco fields with the highly flammable moonshine in the wagon. He says that they will pretend to be just another delivery wagon when entering the Grays' property to avoid suspicions.
As they approach Caliga Hall, Sean suddenly realises that the Grays will recognise Arthur as he has been working for them. Arthur gives Sean the reins and hides in the back of the wagon so the guards won't see him. Sean drives up to the property and is greeted by a guard named Hamish. He tells Hamish that he is just a new delivery boy, so the guard climbs aboard the wagon with Sean to direct him to the warehouse and they have a friendly chat. Once in the warehouse, Sean distracts Hamish by talking with him so Arthur can kill him from behind. Once Hamish is dead, they shut the doors and wait for nightfall.
Once it's dark, Sean and Arthur prepare the fire bottles to use on the fields. As they sneak outside, they hear another wagon arriving and hide. They realise that it's a supply wagon carrying payroll, which could be a good bonus. As Sean makes his way to the barn, Arthur begins working on the fields. He slowly pours moonshine into each one while hiding in the crops to avoid the patrolling guards. Arthur then meets up with Sean at the barn. Sean gives the barn a quick dousing before Arthur tosses a fire bottle into it, setting it ablaze.
The two then throw more bottles into the fields to burn them down. This alerts the guards, who open fire on the duo. During the firefight, Sean spots two horses to escape on, but the horses get scared by the gunfire and bolt off, so Arthur and Sean shoot their way through the burning fields (with Sean clearly enjoying it) towards the supply wagon they saw before to take its horses instead. Upon reaching it, Arthur untethers the horses while Sean searches the wagon for the payroll. He soon finds it and the pair ride off, killing more guards before finally escaping.
Once they are safe, Arthur and Sean comment on the night's events. The player can then choose to head back to camp with Sean or stay behind.

Overview: To get back at the Braithwaites, Tavish Gray asks Arthur, John and Javier to steal prized horses from Braithwaite Manor that he claims will sell for $5000.
Story/Walkthrough:
Arthur, John, and Javier group at the stables at Caliga Hall, where they are tasked by Tavish Gray to steal the Braithwaites' prized horses.
The three make their way to the south side of Braithwaite Manor, where they are stopped by a guard. John lies that the group are there to make a large investment in the stables, which convinces the guard to allow them access to the grounds.
At the stable, Arthur approaches the stablehand and questions him about the valuable horses. At first, the groom pretends to be confused, acting as if he does not know about the horses. However, Arthur persuades the stableman and he agrees to escort the trio to them.
The stablehand speaks about the horses, detailing their names and history. During his speech, Arthur quietly grabs the groom, wraps his arms around his throat and strangles the stablehand to his death.
The three equip their bandanas while Javier tethers the three horses together, mounting the one at the front.
With John leading the way and Arthur bringing up the rear, the group fights their way out of the grounds. One of the stallions manages to break the tether and escape, but Arthur is quick to lasso it back.
The three traverse the open fields of Scarlett Meadows as they make their way to meet with a horse fence named Clay Davies at Clemens Cove. The trio sells the prized steeds for only $700, a small fraction of the amount of money they were promised.

Overview: Arthur and Charles go to track down Trelawny at his rental caravan in Rhodes.
Story/Walkthrough:
Remembering Trelawny's warnings about bounty hunters in the area, Arthur goes to speak with Dutch, who brushes it off as most likely a rumor, but nonetheless asks him and Charles to go check on Trelawny, as they haven't heard from him for some time. The pair investigate his caravan in Rhodes and find signs of violence, before deducing that he must have been taken by bounty hunters.
Arthur and Charles follow Trelawny's trail to the woods, where they find two men - with Trelawny's walking cane next to them. They each subdue a man and interrogate one of them, who informs them that Trelawny is being held at a nearby farm near Braithwaite Manor.
The pair ride there and find Trelawny and the bounty hunters (working under Cole Stoudemire) who kidnapped him near the Braithwaite family's corn fields, but the hunters scatter into the fields upon being discovered, forcing Arthur and Charles to search for them in a game of cat and mouse.
After dealing with all three bounty hunters - one of whom takes Arthur hostage and is killed by Charles - the duo take care of two more hiding in the barn before return to Trelawny, who claims that he told his kidnappers nothing. He then decides to stay with the gang at their camp, until it's safe to live on his own again. The mission ends with Charles and Trelawny leaving Arthur and riding back to camp.

Overview: Trelawny invites Arthur to see a discouraged worker at Rhodes post office about any available stagecoaches to rob.
Story/Walkthrough:
Arthur speaks to Trelawny at camp, who asks him to come to Rhodes to speak to a teller at the post office, who will be able to provide Arthur with tips about stagecoaches worth stealing.
Once Arthur and Trelawny reach town, they enter the post office, where Trelawny will start a conversation with the teller, Alden Carruthers. After a bit of small talk, Arthur gives him some money in exchange for information on a stagecoach which is due to come through Siltwater Strand. Before the pair leave, Alden tells them that there is another clerk in Strawberry who is a member of the “discouraged men” association (as Trelawny calls it).
On their way to Siltwater Strand, Arthur makes known his apprehension on returning to Strawberry, considering the damage he caused there when he rescued Micah. Trelawny assures him that there should not be anyone left who would remember him, considering that nearly the whole town was massacred. He also comments on how popular the gang is becoming with all the trouble they have been causing, and believes they will all be dead soon enough. Arthur replies that he hopes they will all be free before that happens.
Once they reach the interception point, Trelawny decides to not rob the coach violently and tells Arthur to keep his guns holstered. He hands Arthur a lock breaker to open the strongbox in the back of the coach silently while he distracts an opera singer, Chester Damsen, and her driver. They see the coach, and Trelawny rides up to it and convinces Damsen to sing to him while Arthur rides further behind to avoid being seen. While Damsen sings to Trelawny, Arthur silently opens the lockbox, seizes the money, and sneaks away.
Trelawny joins him soon afterwards after the coach leaves, and the two share the take between them.

Overview: Suspecting a trap, Micah asks Arthur to observe an arranged meeting between Dutch and Colm O'Driscoll from afar.
Story/Walkthrough:
Pearson met some O'Driscolls on the road who said they wanted to arrange a parley. Hosea calls it a trap, but Micah seems to think it is worth looking into and helps convince Dutch to go. Arthur accompanies Dutch and Micah as a bodyguard to watch over the meeting from a distance. Arthur takes the high ground; Dutch and Colm meet. Dutch attempts to make amends, but it is clear that Colm is only there to sneer at Dutch and his gang. Some O'Driscolls sneak up on Arthur, knock him out, and abduct him.
Arthur is wounded, tortured and imprisoned. Colm comes to gloat over Arthur; he explains that the parley was merely a ruse to capture Arthur so that Dutch would attempt to rescue him. Colm arranged to have the law waiting to arrest the entire Van der Linde gang if Dutch did come at that moment. After this, Colm leaves. Arthur manages to escape his bonds, kills an O'Driscoll, and escapes the camp in which he was held. He returns to Clemens Point on horseback and collapses. He is then found by Mary-Beth, Karen and Dutch, who calls Susan and Swanson for help. Pearson also arrives and they carry Arthur to his tent. Dutch asks Susan to stay with him, which she does, telling him he's gonna be okay and that he's home. His recovery will take a few weeks, thanks to Susan and Tilly.

Overview: Working with the Braithwaites, Arthur and Sean drive to Caliga Hall with the remaining moonshine and attempt to use it to burn the Grays' tobacco fields.
Story/Walkthrough:
Arthur arrives at Braithwaite Manor and tells the guards he has business with Catherine Braithwaite, so the guards let him in. Arthur enters the manor and the butler takes him into the living room where Catherine, Hosea and Sean are playing Cribbage. Bartholomew, one of the sons is also there. Catherine asks if Arthur is as "dumb as he looks", but Hosea assures her he will get the job done if the payment is right. Bartholomew responds to this with an insult before Sean and Arthur leave and head outside to a wagon loaded with moonshine, with Arthur bluntly denying Sean's request to drive.
As they set off, Arthur comments on how silent Sean was earlier. Sean says that it wasn't easy and expresses his dislike for Bartholomew and Catherine, which makes Arthur laugh. He then explains that they are going to burn down the Grays' tobacco fields with the highly flammable moonshine in the wagon. He says that they will pretend to be just another delivery wagon when entering the Grays' property to avoid suspicions.
As they approach Caliga Hall, Sean suddenly realises that the Grays will recognise Arthur as he has been working for them. Arthur gives Sean the reins and hides in the back of the wagon so the guards won't see him. Sean drives up to the property and is greeted by a guard named Hamish. He tells Hamish that he is just a new delivery boy, so the guard climbs aboard the wagon with Sean to direct him to the warehouse and they have a friendly chat. Once in the warehouse, Sean distracts Hamish by talking with him so Arthur can kill him from behind. Once Hamish is dead, they shut the doors and wait for nightfall.
Once it's dark, Sean and Arthur prepare the fire bottles to use on the fields. As they sneak outside, they hear another wagon arriving and hide. They realise that it's a supply wagon carrying payroll, which could be a good bonus. As Sean makes his way to the barn, Arthur begins working on the fields. He slowly pours moonshine into each one while hiding in the crops to avoid the patrolling guards. Arthur then meets up with Sean at the barn. Sean gives the barn a quick dousing before Arthur tosses a fire bottle into it, setting it ablaze.
The two then throw more bottles into the fields to burn them down. This alerts the guards, who open fire on the duo. During the firefight, Sean spots two horses to escape on, but the horses get scared by the gunfire and bolt off, so Arthur and Sean shoot their way through the burning fields (with Sean clearly enjoying it) towards the supply wagon they saw before to take its horses instead. Upon reaching it, Arthur untethers the horses while Sean searches the wagon for the payroll. He soon finds it and the pair ride off, killing more guards before finally escaping.
Once they are safe, Arthur and Sean comment on the night's events. The player can then choose to head back to camp with Sean or stay behind.

Overview: Arthur, Micah, Bill and Sean go to meet some of the Gray boys in Rhodes to discuss a security job.
Story/Walkthrough:
Arthur meets the other three gang members in Rhodes for the “job”, although both he and Sean are deeply suspicious. Before they can voice any more concerns, they are suddenly ambushed by the Grays. Sean is instantly killed by a shot to the head, and Bill is shot in the shoulder. A massive shootout erupts between the remaining three outlaws and the Gray gunmen.
During the gunfight, Bill is captured by Sheriff Leigh Gray, leaving only Arthur and Micah to fight off the Grays. Both of them break into the Gunsmith's and use it as cover. After the two come out victorious, they approach the Sheriff's office and demand the release of Bill. Along with Archibald MacGregor and two other lawmen, the Sheriff comes out with a gun to Bill's head but is promptly shot in the head and killed by Arthur. In the next few seconds, Archibald and his two allies are subsequently gunned down by Arthur, or by Micah if the player is not quick enough.
With the gunfight over, Arthur reprimands Bill and Micah for their carelessness and expresses his affection for Sean, before asking Bill to give Sean a proper burial.

Overview: Uncle receives a tip-off and rides off with Arthur, Charles and Bill to rob a wagon carrying payroll.
Story/Walkthrough:
In camp, Molly O'Shea calls Arthur over to talk to him about Dutch. However, they are quickly interrupted by Uncle, who has received a tip-off about a supply wagon which is allegedly unguarded. Arthur is at first reluctant, but agrees on it as long as Uncle comes along.
Arthur, Uncle, Charles, and Bill ride out to the crossroads and see the wagon. However, after they stop it, the wagon driver reveals that he works for Cornwall Kerosene & Tar, so when Charles and Arthur loot the wagon, a large number of Cornwall's guards in the vicinity descend upon the gang. Realising that they cannot win by fighting, the gang members flee on horseback into the woods, before hiding in an abandoned barn in an attempt to lose their pursuers.
At night, some of Cornwall's guards arrive on the property to search for the four gang members. An inhabitant of the house informs the guards that they heard something coming from the barn a few hours ago, and so the guards head towards it. The gang try to stay hidden as the guards enter, but Bill accidentally knocks over a bucket, and the gang is forced to fight, with huge numbers of guards attacking them from every direction. The barn eventually begins to burn down during the skirmish due to a smashed lantern, resulting in the four retreating into the woods.
Once in the trees, they split up; Arthur goes with Uncle and Charles goes with Bill, and after eventually reuniting and finishing off the last of their pursuers, the four split the take and separately make their way back to camp.

Overview: Following a lead about the Lemoyne Raiders sitting on a pile of weapons, Lenny and Arthur ride out deep into the woods towards Shady Belle.
Story/Walkthrough:
Lenny calls over Arthur in camp, telling him that he has heard of a manor called Shady Belle deep in the woods used by the Lemoyne Raiders. Lenny explains that they are delusional ex-confederates who still want an army and, in order to fund it, they have a huge stockpile of weapons at their hideout, which they can sell to finance their operations. With finding some weapons guaranteed and the possibility of getting money on top of that, Arthur agrees to investigate the manor with Lenny, and the two depart from camp.
During the ride, Arthur and Lenny discuss the Lemoyne Raiders and talk about how, unlike out West, many people don't treat others as equals and how they can be cruel and even violent towards non-white races. Though this makes Lenny uneasy, he is still determined to do his bit for the gang, which impresses Arthur.
Upon arriving at Bolger Glade, Arthur and Lenny investigate the area and spot a wagon loaded with dynamite passing by. They follow it into the woods and see Shady Belle up ahead. They take their horses into the woods, while Arthur takes out a scoped rifle to survey the manor. After analyzing the explosives, guards, and layout of the place, Arthur suggests that Lenny could go in and act “friendly” with the Raiders in order to draw them in. The player can decide whether to do this or simply shoot a large box of dynamite in the hideout, killing some of the Raiders. Either way, a large firefight breaks out between Arthur and Lenny against the Raiders, with the pair emerging victorious. With their enemies dealt with, Arthur and Lenny find a cart with a stash of weapons in the back and decide to take it back to camp.
Soon after they leave the woods, three more Raiders spot them stealing their wagon and threaten them, only to be gunned down by Arthur and Lenny, who continue on. Arthur praises Lenny's abilities and says that the more senior gang members look favorably on him. The pair eventually reach camp and Arthur takes out a rifle from the stash as his own, before he and Lenny thank each other for the heist.

Overview: With the heat in Valentine having died down, Bill decides it's finally time to hit the bank. Karen causes a distraction while Arthur handles the vaults.
Story/Walkthrough:
While in camp at Clemens Point, Bill asks Arthur to speak with him. Informing Arthur that him and Karen have planned to rob the bank in Valentine, Bill tells Arthur to come along. Arthur is skeptical at first, but eventually comes around to the idea. Lenny joins the group, and the four change into new clothes and prepare to ride out. Before they leave, Strauss informs Arthur that Thomas Downes is dead and that his wife has the debt he was supposed to pay, and tells Arthur to reclaim it.
After arriving at Valentine, the player can choose whether Karen can pretend to be either a drunken harlot or a lost dame, and she enters the bank. After the people inside are off-guard, Arthur, Bill and Lenny burst in and hold up the bank. Lenny gives Karen the key and she opens the door behind the counter, and Arthur takes the teller and forces him to open the vault door. However, the teller can't open the safes, so the player is forced to either crack them silently or use dynamite. If the safes are cracked, lawmen don't start pursuing the group until they've almost reached their horses. If dynamite is used, the gang must fight their way from the bank to their horses. After mounting up, the gang members ride out of Valentine and kill pursuing lawmen, eventually losing them thanks to a passing train, and they split the cash.
Afterwards, Arthur rides off to the Downes Ranch to get a debt from Thomas's wife. He will offer a half-hearted apology to her before getting into a minor confrontation with her son. She gives him the money, and Arthur leaves, heading back to camp.

Overview: Having just arrived in Saint Denis, Dutch and Arthur ask around the Bastille Saloon for information on Angelo Bronte.
Story/Walkthrough:
Arthur arrives at the saloon, and someone aims a gun at his head telling him to surrender. However, it is just Dutch having a bit of fun. He and Arthur talk about the city and how the bar should have some leads about Angelo Bronte. Dutch has already had no luck, so he tells Arthur to try himself and leaves. Arthur enters the bar and asks the bartender for information on Bronte. The bartender, however, refuses to divulge anything. Shortly after, a bar patron approaches Arthur, saying the street urchins in the back alley of the saloon may know about the man he is looking for.
Following the man's advice, Arthur heads into the back alleys to find the urchins, and inquires about Bronte. Two of them agree to help Arthur in exchange for $5. While they guide him on a tour of the city, one of the kids named Cleet steals Arthur's satchel and runs away with it, forcing Arthur to chase him.
If Arthur is able to catch the thief: Cleet gives Arthur's satchel back and tells him about where Bronte lives, after which Arthur tells him to "get lost" and they part ways.
If Arthur fails to catch the thief: Cleet leads Arthur into an ambush where several other urchins - some of which are armed - are waiting for him. One of them, who seems to be the leader of this gang, tells Arthur where to find Bronte, and returns his satchel to him.
Arthur subsequently meets with Dutch and upon relaying the location of Bronte's house, they decide to meet up across from it with John later.

Overview: Susan and Arthur head to the Foreman Brothers' hideout to rescue Tilly, who has been kidnapped.
Story/Walkthrough:
In camp, Arthur greets Mary-Beth and the two talk while having a smoke. Susan Grimshaw interrupts the conversation and tells Arthur that Tilly has been taken by the Foreman Brothers. She grabs a revolver and tells Arthur to come with her to rescue Tilly who the Foreman Brothers took to a place called Radley's House.
When Arthur and Susan arrive at the place, Susan speaks to a lone gang member and kills him with a knife. She tells Arthur to get inside, and two more gang members are caught off guard when Arthur enters the house. Arthur then frees Tilly who is tied to a chair in a bedroom. She thanks the two for saving her and she tells them that Anthony Foreman and the gang kidnapped her. She also says that Anthony and some other gang members went out hunting. When Arthur opens the back door, Anthony and two gang members are seen fleeing on their horses. Tilly tells them to capture Anthony and bring him back alive so that she can confront him. Arthur and Susan chase the Foreman Brothers and kill the first two before Arthur lassos Anthony and brings him back to the house, while Susan takes Anthony's horse.
Back at the house, Tilly and an enraged Susan argue with Anthony and tell him to leave Tilly alone, which Anthony promises when Arthur threatens to kill him. Susan tells Arthur that it his choice whether to kill or spare Anthony before she takes Tilly back to camp.

Overview: Arthur, John, and Dutch head to Angelo Bronte's mansion to get Jack back. Bronte asks the gang to clear out the local graveyard of thieves in return for Jack.
Story/Walkthrough:
Arthur meets Dutch and John in the park, across the street from Angelo Bronte's house. As they approach the house, Arthur worries that if they get violent, Jack will likely get killed, but Dutch says that if they stay calm, it will be fine.
Upon reaching the gates, Dutch grabs a guard and orders him to summon Bronte. Afterwards, they are let in, and the group meet Bronte, who is not happy to see them. After Dutch explains that they are just "simple, country folk" and that Jack's kidnapping was almost meaningless, making the group appear innocent, Bronte expresses his fondness for Dutch and shakes his hand warmly. After a short discussion, Arthur and John agree to go out and kill some grave-robbers at the cemetery, while Dutch stays behind to talk with Bronte.
On the way to the cemetery, Arthur compliments John on how calm he was with Bronte. John expresses his distrust in Bronte and also his regret at being a bad father to Jack. Arthur assures him that the Braithwaites gave Jack to Bronte for money, but since the Braithwaites are now all dead and cannot pay him, Bronte has no more use for Jack and that the boy should be alright.
Arthur and John arrive and the cemetery and eventually find the robbers, killing them in a shootout. They then find their stash, but before they can leave a number of lawmen arrive. John and Arthur sneak around them, eventually getting out of the cemetery, and they return to Bronte's mansion. Dutch is seen with Jack outside, and the group ride back to camp, with Jack talking fondly of his time at the Bronte mansion, with John relieved he was treated well. Dutch also tells Arthur that Bronte has invited them to a garden party at the Mayor's house. After arriving at camp, Abigail is overjoyed to see Jack and a party is thrown to celebrate his return.
During the celebration, players will be unable to do most activities or save the game. This is highly problematic for players who wish to exit the game during celebrations, as it is likely to result in players losing their progress.

Overview: Brother Dorkins asks Arthur to investigate a nearby shop suspected of acting as a front for human trafficking.
Story/Walkthrough:
While walking in Saint Denis, Arthur encounters a monk named Dorkins. Dorkins asks Arthur to donate money to the church, and he can either agree to donate or refuse. Dorkins will then ask him to go to the local fence, who he believes is illegally trafficking children from the Spanish isles.
Arthur enters the store and the owner greets him. Arthur can intimidate the shop owner until he reveals where the children are located. However, this will prevent getting the gold medal for the mission.
Alternatively, the player can use Eagle Eye which will lead them to the bookcase or head over to the bookcase where Arthur will notice the scratch marks on the wooden floor. The shop owner will get nervous when the player heads to the bookcase and when the player opens the door the shop owner will run away.
Arthur finds two kids chained against the wall, then frees them, who address in Spanish how grateful they are for his helping them, and brings them back to Dorkins, who offers him the option of taking money from the donation bowl for his payment. Arthur can either take the money, or tell Dorkins to save it for someone in need.

Overview: While planning the Saint Denis trolley robbery, Dutch notices a wave of O'Driscolls attacking the camp, but not before displaying Kieran's corpse.
Story/Walkthrough:
Dutch asks Arthur to talk to him about the trolley robbery that Bronte tipped him off about. Arthur asks if it will be just the two of them, but Dutch tells them they'll need a third. Arthur recommends Lenny while Dutch asks why not Micah. Arthur tells him that Micah is too reckless and that they will never get along. Their conversation is interrupted when Dutch notices an odd figure riding a horse into camp. Mary-Beth screams in horror and recognizes the figure as Kieran; his head has been decapitated from his neck and placed in his hands with his eyes gouged out after he disappeared during the party celebrating the return of Jack.
A horde of O'Driscolls then begin to invade and attack the camp. Arthur shoots at the first wave of attackers from the balcony before Dutch sends him down to the front door to defend the main area of the camp. The non-fighting members rush inside the house to hide, while the rest continue fending off the O'Driscolls. However, the gang is overwhelmed by their numbers and is forced to retreat back to the house. After the front door is barricaded, Dutch assigns John, Charles, and Arthur different positions to defend. As they continue the fight from inside, Arthur hears several loud screams from outside. Recognizing the voice as Sadie's, he heads out to save her but arrives to find her killing three O'Driscolls with a knife. They and the other gang members kill the rest of the attacking O'Driscolls, while the few survivors run away.
Dutch then asks Charles, Swanson, and Pearson to bury Kieran while Arthur and John clear out the corpses, but not before being told by Arthur how hateful Colm is. Arthur writes in his journal in a cutscene, where he regrets not being able to save Kieran's life. Kieran's death has a lasting impact on the gang, notably Arthur for failing to save him, Bill because he had grown fond of him, and Mary-Beth who had implicitly fallen in love with him.

Overview: After receiving a tip from Angelo Bronte about a trolley station in Saint Denis holding a large amount of cash, Dutch, Arthur and Lenny meet to rob it.
Story/Walkthrough:
Arthur meets Dutch and Lenny in an alley across from the trolley station. Dutch explains that once they get enough money, he plans to have the gang go to either Australia or Tahiti for a better future. He says that he met with the captain of a ship who will take them to one these places if they pay him. Arthur seems doubtful about this, wondering where they will get enough money for a whole boat and a new home, prompting Dutch to point out the trolley station. He reminds Arthur that they don't have much time before the Pinkertons find them and that they need a lot of money, which the station should have.
Arthur, Dutch and Lenny put on their bandanas and enter the station, announcing the robbery. On Dutch's order, Arthur robs three people before forcing the clerk to unlock the safe. But instead of a large take, Arthur only finds a few dollars, just as Lenny sees a large number of armed police outside. Realizing they'd been set up by Bronte, Dutch quickly makes an escape plan, and the trio rush outside and jump aboard a passing trolley as it's moving. They gun down a multitude of police as they ride through the streets before Dutch tells Arthur to slow down the trolley. Arthur attempts to decrease its speed, but the brakes malfunction and the trolley goes off the rails, crashing on its side in the street.
Shaken, the three fight off more police and make their way through the streets until they come across a wagon. With Lenny driving, Dutch and Arthur kill all of the pursuing lawmen until they eventually escape Saint Denis.
The money is split, with Arthur remarking that the three of them each got $15 and a quarter. Dutch is outraged that Bronte set them up, especially since he did nothing wrong to him. He decides that the Saint Denis Bank is now their only hope of paying for their freedom. Lenny then leaves to take Dutch back to camp.

Overview: Before they can rob the Saint Denis bank, Dutch convinces Arthur that they must kill Angelo Bronte. They visit Thomas, a local fisherman, to procure a skiff for the assault on Bronte's mansion.
Story/Walkthrough:
Arthur finds Hosea Matthews and Dutch arguing about murdering Bronte, with Hosea believing it will be foolish and warning Dutch about taking revenge which the latter denies, pointing out that Bronte controls the entire town and that their planned robbery of Saint Denis bank will not be successful unless they get rid of him, Arthur sides with Dutch on the matter. Arthur and Dutch eventually leave and travel to Lagras to meet Thomas, a fisherman who will take them behind Bronte's mansion.
On their way to Lagras, Arthur asks Dutch if going after Bronte is for the bank robbery or revenge for the failed trolley station robbery. Dutch replies that that is not important and that it is necessary if the whole gang is going to have a better life. Their discussion soon moves to a frustrated Dutch asking Arthur for more faith and saying that everyone does not seem to trust him anymore, with Micah being the only loyal one. Arthur manages to calm Dutch down by pointing out that he is also still loyal, as he is riding with him right now, and has followed him for twenty years.
After arriving, the duo help Thomas check crawfish traps, then they look for Jules, a young fisherman who has the boat they need. Arthur finds him hiding in a tree, trying to escape from a "monster". As he climbs down, Arthur gets the skiff free from a large tree limb, and the four men start going back to shore. However, they get stuck, and Jules gets out to free the boat. After doing this, he is attacked by the monster, a Bullgator, and Arthur enters the water to get Jules back. He eventually does, and runs to the boat with the Bullgator chasing him. After reaching the boat, Arthur and Dutch shoot at the Bullgator to try and deter it, and start rowing back to shore. Arthur wraps up Jules' damaged leg and stops the bleeding, and Jules passes out.
They eventually reach the village, and two men help the injured Jules away. Dutch leaves to collect some of the gang members and tells Arthur to meet them back at the village later.

Overview: Gang members Dutch van der Linde, Arthur Morgan, John Marston, Bill Williamson, and Lenny Summers attack Bronte's mansion from the river to get rid of the threat of Bronte's men and to take revenge for the trolley station setup.
Story/Walkthrough:
The gang lands at the pier near Bronte's manor, and hop the wall into Bronte's front yard. They move stealthily until they get close, where either John or Arthur will initiate the fighting by attacking two gangsters that stand in the way of their approach. Gangsters fill the area in front of his mansion, and open fire upon the gang in an attempt to protect Bronte. Nevertheless, the gang kills off the gangsters and storms the building. They quickly clear off the bottom floor, before searching for him, and finding him upstairs. John will knock him out. It is worth the slight time delay to loot his body, as it yields a large cash reward, which should cover the bounty placed on your head following the assault. As they haul him towards the boat, lawmen assault the gang in an attempt to bring them to jail, dead or alive, for kidnapping. The gang breaks past the innumerable police officers, and gets to the boat.
On the way back, Dutch and Bronte get into a heated argument. Bronte then insults Dutch's outlaw lifestyle and attempts to offer a huge sum of money to any of his gang members in exchange for them betraying and killing Dutch, to no avail. An enraged Dutch then drowns Bronte, and feeds his corpse to an alligator, much to Arthur's and John's shock and disgust.

Overview: The gang prepare to rob the bank in Saint Denis as one final score that would allow them to retire.
Story/Walkthrough:
In order to fund their escape overseas and retirement from the life of crime, the gang prepare for one last job: robbing Lemoyne National Bank in Saint Denis. Although the robbery starts off well, Pinkertons quickly arrive on the scene. Hosea is held hostage after being captured by Agent Milton during the distraction that he orchestrated. Milton angrily orders Dutch to exit the bank, but the latter tries to coax a deal out of the former—letting Hosea go so that they can avoid unnecessary killing—to no avail. Knowing that Hosea had not and would not agree to his deal of handing over Van der Linde, Milton kills him, angering Arthur and Dutch. A shootout ensues between the gang and the Pinkertons.
With the gunfight unwinnable, Dutch has Arthur plant dynamite on the wall inside the bank, allowing the outlaws to escape to the rooftop and escape. While the rest of the gang are escaping, John is captured alive by Pinkertons and later sent to Sisika Penitentiary to be incarcerated. Along with this, Lenny is killed by Pinkerton gunmen during the escape on the rooftops. The remaining six - Dutch, Arthur, Micah, Bill, Javier and Charles - hide in an abandoned apartment and wait until night to escape. Dutch decides to escape on a boat and leave the country, so the six proceed to the docks. Along the way, Charles distracts some Pinkerton guards and allows the other five to enter a boat bound for the Pacific.

Overview: After a few days at sea, a torrential storm strikes the Antenor, and the Van der Linde gang are forced to abandon ship.
Story/Walkthrough: Aboard the Antenor and asleep, Arthur wakes up suddenly to find Dutch urging him to get up. A harsh storm has hit the ship and they are all in danger. Still groggy, Arthur follows Dutch, Micah, Javier and Bill through the ship, but a violent jolt knocks over some heavy crates down between him and Dutch, separating them. Arthur goes to find a way around, but by the time he reaches the deck of the severely damaged ship, he sees that Dutch and the others are already at sea in a lifeboat. Arthur helplessly yells out to them before he and several other crewmembers leap off the doomed Antenor and into the dark, raging waves below.

Overview: Arthur, John, and Dutch head to Angelo Bronte's mansion to get Jack back. Bronte asks the gang to clear out the local graveyard of thieves in return for Jack.
Story/Walkthrough:
Arthur meets Dutch and John in the park, across the street from Angelo Bronte's house. As they approach the house, Arthur worries that if they get violent, Jack will likely get killed, but Dutch says that if they stay calm, it will be fine.
Upon reaching the gates, Dutch grabs a guard and orders him to summon Bronte. Afterwards, they are let in, and the group meet Bronte, who is not happy to see them. After Dutch explains that they are just "simple, country folk" and that Jack's kidnapping was almost meaningless, making the group appear innocent, Bronte expresses his fondness for Dutch and shakes his hand warmly. After a short discussion, Arthur and John agree to go out and kill some grave-robbers at the cemetery, while Dutch stays behind to talk with Bronte.
On the way to the cemetery, Arthur compliments John on how calm he was with Bronte. John expresses his distrust in Bronte and also his regret at being a bad father to Jack. Arthur assures him that the Braithwaites gave Jack to Bronte for money, but since the Braithwaites are now all dead and cannot pay him, Bronte has no more use for Jack and that the boy should be alright.
Arthur and John arrive and the cemetery and eventually find the robbers, killing them in a shootout. They then find their stash, but before they can leave a number of lawmen arrive. John and Arthur sneak around them, eventually getting out of the cemetery, and they return to Bronte's mansion. Dutch is seen with Jack outside, and the group ride back to camp, with Jack talking fondly of his time at the Bronte mansion, with John relieved he was treated well. Dutch also tells Arthur that Bronte has invited them to a garden party at the Mayor's house. After arriving at camp, Abigail is overjoyed to see Jack and a party is thrown to celebrate his return.
During the celebration, players will be unable to do most activities or save the game. This is highly problematic for players who wish to exit the game during celebrations, as it is likely to result in players losing their progress.

Overview: The gang attend a party hosted by the Mayor of Saint Denis. While at the party, they meet with Bronte, and look for job opportunities.
Story/Walkthrough:
At Shady Belle, Arthur speaks with Hosea before Dutch appears, saying that they need to go and buy themselves some proper clothing for Mayor Lemieux's garden party that Bronte invited them to, much to Arthur's disbelief.
That evening, Arthur, Dutch, Hosea and Bill, all wearing smart tuxedos, are traveling by coach to the party, laughing at the fact that the honored guest is a dangerous crime lord of all people. Upon arriving the group hand in their weapons before being escorted to the mansion by Luca, a servant. Hosea and Bill go and join the party while Dutch and Arthur meet with Bronte on the balcony.
Bronte greets them warmly and starts pointing out and mocking some of the party guests, including Mayor Henri Lemieux, Alberto Fussar, Hobart Crawley and his wife Brenda, Eagle Flies and Rains Fall who are giving a letter to the mayor, and Hector Fellowes whom Bronte suggests Dutch could kill for him some day, to Dutch's disinclination. Dutch tells Bronte that they need some money, and Bronte explains that the local trolley station should have more than enough cash for them. Dutch thanks him before he and Arthur leave with Luca.
Dutch and Arthur head downstairs and meet with Hosea and Bill. Dutch tells Arthur to go and find the mayor, and Hosea to look for another robbery target. Arthur can mingle with guests until he finds Mayor Lemieux near the fountain with some men, which include Evelyn Miller, who is being insulted by a drunken man. Arthur grabs the man and leads him away from the group. Lemieux thanks Arthur and introduces himself and Miller to him just as the fireworks begin. The mayor's butler, Pierre appears and tells Lemieux that he received a phone call from Leviticus Cornwall. Dutch overhears this and has Arthur follow Pierre to find out about it.
Arthur tails Pierre silently through the mansion until they come to the mayor's office. Once Pierre leaves, Arthur unlocks the desk draw and retrieves some documents the mayor was supposed to sign. Arthur finds the others outside and they leave with two more robberies in mind: a high-stakes Poker game on a riverboat, and the Saint Denis Bank. On their way home, Bill grumpily expresses his embarrassment of the whole thing, believing it to be "torture." Arthur gives the documents to Dutch, who starts forming another plan.
The next day, Dutch wakes Arthur up in his room and explains to him the plans for the new robberies, as well as Evelyn Miller and the Indians, who they could try and help. Optimistically, Dutch tells Arthur that they are "almost home" and all they need is just one more score.

Overview: Mary asks Arthur for help with her father, who has become consumed by a gambling addiction. Arthur must retrieve a valuable family heirloom Mary's father has sold off.
Story/Walkthrough:
Arthur receives a letter from Mary Linton, asking him to come and meet her in Saint Denis. Arthur later finds her at the hotel, and, after talking, she asks for help with her father. Arthur refuses at first, but eventually gives in and takes Mary to the stables to find him. Mary enters the stable to check on her father, leaving Arthur to wait outside. While waiting outside of the stable, a young man cleaning the sidewalk tells Arthur to leave the street. This irritates Arthur who proceeds to threaten the young man with death should he continue telling him to leave.
Mary soon comes out with her father, who berates her for coming after him. Mr. Gillis walks off, and the two proceed to follow him; they soon watch him sell her mother's brooch for money to a loan shark named Ashton. Ashton offers give Mary's father a loan, but her father declines the offer. Mary confronts her father while Arthur chases after Ashton to get the brooch back. On horseback, Arthur chases the fleeing wagon and leaps onto it, throwing the driver off and hijacking it. Arthur takes the stagecoach to the swampland surrounding Saint Denis, and afterwards threatens Ashton to hand over the brooch. Some extra loot can be found in the lock box at the back of the wagon.
Arthur finds Mary again, who informs him that her father disappeared. When Arthur offers to find him again, Mary declines. After returning the brooch, the two begin walking to the trolley station. During their walk, Mary stops and asks Arthur if they could go to the theater. The player has the option to go with her or refuse her offer.
If Mary's request is accepted, they buy tickets into the theater and watch a number of acts. After this, the two make their way to the trolley station, where Mary asks Arthur to elope with her. Arthur states that he wants to, but the gang needs him. Despite this, Arthur agrees to come with her once he has some business dealt with.

Overview: While at the Mayor's party, the Van der Linde gang learned of a poker tournament being held on the Grand Korrigan riverboat at the docks in Saint Denis. Leopold Strauss and Josiah Trelawny fix a game so Arthur Morgan can win big on the tables.
Story/Walkthrough:
Arthur meets Trelawny in Saint Denis. Trelawny informs Arthur that in order to get on the riverboat, he'll need to smarten up. He takes Arthur to the tailor's the buy a new suit, then to the barber for a trim. Trelawny informs Arthur that their mark is Desmond Blythe and that Blythe keeps extra collateral in the safe in the Grand Korrigan. Afterwards, they ride to the riverboat in a carriage, and Trelawny informs Arthur of the plan, and tells him his cover is that he's an oil man. Trelawny also tells Arthur that the driver of the carriage and the dealer are now allies of his.
After arriving, Arthur leaves his weapons in the carriage, and walks to the boat along with Trelawny, Strauss, and Javier Escuella. Once on the boat, the four split up, while Arthur heads to the tables. He starts playing, with Strauss subtly conveying what he should do. With Strauss' help, Arthur quickly becomes the only player in the game besides Blythe, who causes the other players to go bust. Arthur beats Blythe in the next round, but Blythe challenges Arthur to a second game, putting his valuable Reutlinger Pocket Watch on the line. Arthur accepts, and quickly beats Blythe again. The pit boss congratulates Arthur on his victory and takes him upstairs to the vault, with Javier leading the way, disguised as a guard. Once the safe is open, Javier knocks out another guard, and holds the pit boss at gunpoint. Arthur disarms him, but while looting the safe, it is revealed that he has another gun.
Arthur quickly kills him and loots the safe, receiving a big take and Blythe's watch, and the duo move back to the bar, where Blythe is seen talking to Trelawny and accuses Arthur of cheating in the game. Suddenly, the guard whose clothes were taken by Javier appears and yells for the latter to be shot, causing a gunfight to erupt. After fighting their way to the deck, Arthur, Javier, Strauss, and Trelawny jump off the boat and swim to shore.
Upon reaching safety, the four share the take. After Strauss confirms that the stolen watch is valuable, Arthur takes it back, and the group split up.
